documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-02 ---

SA-P009 — Cycle 1, Day 1 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 128/85, heart rate 70, weight 79.8 kg.

Adverse event noted: Headache — moderate (CTCAE Grade 2). Onset day 19. Resolved by day 35. Assessed as unlikely to study drug. No dose modification required.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 4.85 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 27.89 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 18.43 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.19 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 10.27 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.75 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-06-23 ---

SA-P009 — Cycle 2, Day 1 visit.

On exam, BP is 129/100, pulse 55, wt 96.7 kg. Patient appears mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

Significant tiredness reported — classified as Grade 1 fatigue. Onset day 22. Resolved by day 25. No dose modification required.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 4.74 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 26.25 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 17.89 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.67 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 10.12 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.77 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

PSA now 6.71 ng/mL — decrease 5.2% from initial value.

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-07-14 ---

Patient SA-P009 presents for scheduled cycle 3 visit.

Vitals: BP 142/75 mmHg, HR 67 bpm, Weight 87.4 kg.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 3.45 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 27.99 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 20.17 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.32 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 9.82 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.79 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 4 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-04 ---

Visit 4 clinical encounter for SA-P009.

On exam, BP is 136/58, pulse 69, wt 60.5 kg. Patient appears slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 4.26 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 26.29 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 18.69 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.59 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 9.57 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.84 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging assessment (CT chest/abdomen/pelvis): Complete response — no measurable disease identified. All previously noted target lesions have resolved. Classified as CR per RECIST 1.1.

Serum PSA: 1.96 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 72.3% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-08-25 ---

Patient SA-P009 presents for scheduled cycle 5 visit.

On exam, BP is 108/69, pulse 70, wt 79.7 kg. Patient appears mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 2.89 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 28.3 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 19.19 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.94 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 9.48 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.85 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Monitor closely and reassess at next visit. Return for cycle 6 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-09-15 ---

Visit 6 clinical encounter for SA-P009.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 153/83, heart rate 78, weight 98.1 kg.

Reports moderate fatigue (Grade 2) since approximately day 112. Resolved by day 136. No dose modification required.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 2.52 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 27.22 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 21.46 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.69 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 9.06 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.86 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Concerning findings on restaging: tumor growth of 42.2%. Progressive disease per RECIST criteria.

Serum PSA: 10.07 ng/mL, representing a increase of 42.2% compared to baseline.

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-06 ---

Patient did not present for scheduled visit 7. Attempted phone contact — patient's family member confirmed patient was unwell.

Patient removed from study protocol following confirmed disease progression on latest imaging. Referred to alternate treatment pathway.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-10-27 ---

Patient did not present for scheduled visit 8. Attempted phone contact — patient reported feeling too unwell to travel to site.
